Feedback: {"content":[{"children":[{"text":"Correct. The odds of an event will be the ratio of the probability that the event will occur to (1 - the probability that the event will occur). In this case, the probability of winning is 80/100. So, (1 - the probability that the event will occur) is 1-(80/100)=20/100. The odds of the event is (80/100)/(20/100). Another way to represent this is 80:20 or 4:1. Alternatively, we know that for every 100 races, the sprinter will win 80 and lose 20. So, we can make the ratio 80:20 or simply it to 4:1."}],"id":"1627720617","type":"p"}],"id":"3165706838"}
